summary: The DOT Victim and Survivor Advocate Act aims to establish a National Roadway Safety Advocate within the Department of Transportation. This advocate will serve as a resource for victims and survivors of road crashes (stakeholders), document their recommendations, and communicate these to the Secretary of Transportation. The advocate will also provide education on Department activities, explain processes in plain language, and facilitate feedback. The position is a career appointment and must submit annual reports highlighting systemic issues and recommending remedies. The bill outlines the advocate's authority and limitations, emphasizing that they cannot make legal determinations, set deadlines, or interfere with existing regulations.
